page.title: 12THE SMIDDY OF TODAY
page.content: NOWADAYS THE BLACKSMITH SHOES ONLY 4 OR 5 HORSES PER WEEK, MAKES FANCY METAL WORK FOR GATES OR FENCES, REPAIRS AND SHARPENS GRASS CUTTERS AND GARDEN TOOLS. THERE IS ONLY ONE FIRE IN THE SMIDDY TODAY, USING 3 TONS OF COAL PER YEAR AT Â£100 PER TON. AN ELECTRIC FAN HAS REPLACED THE OLD BELLOWS WHICH ARE STILL IN GOOD WORKING ORDER FOR POWER CUTS! HE HAS OTHER MODERN TOOLS - AN ELECTRIC DRILL, ELECTRIC SAW AND AN ELECTRO-ACETYLENE WELDER. HE THINKS THE NEW TOOLS ARE EASY TO WORK WITH, BUT HE THINKS THE OLD TOOLS MAKE A BETTER JOB. NOW THAT MR. SKED IS RETIRING, THE CLOSURE OF THE SMIDDY MARKS THE END OF AN ERA IN COUSLAND'S HISTORY.
